Page 42. NSE7 6.4: FortiOS is a 64-bit architecture, therefore the kernel doesn't need to use memory paging to access the whole memory space. All the memory space is directly accessible by the kernel.

comments.content: Cause unit is not in conserve mode lol

choices.D: Kernel indirectly accesses the low memory (LowTotal) through memory paging
choices.A: The unit is running a 32-bit FortiOS
choices.C: The Cached value is always the Active value plus the Inactive value
choices.B: The unit is in kernel conserve mode

choices.C: The local FortiGate is the backup designated router for the wan1 network.
choices.B: The OSPF router with the ID 0.0.0.2 is the designated router for the ToRemote network.
choices.D: The OSPF routers with the IDs 0.0.0.69 and 0.0.0.117 are both designated routers for the wan1 network.

discussion.content: Options in the exam has changed
A and C correct

choices.A: Session would remain in the session table and its traffic would keep using port1 as the outgoing interface.
choices.B: Session would remain in the session table and its traffic would start using port2 as the outgoing interface.
choices.D: Session would remain in the session table and its traffic would be shared between port1 and port2.
choices.C: Session would be deleted, so the client would need to start a new session.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
snat-route-change disable is the default configuration.
All info is flushed in case of a routing change and continues to stay on the same output interface as long as the route is still active.

Answer A

Selected Answer: A
SNAT makes it so A is correct.

A&D are correct
